member.summary: Represents an uncompressed in-memory bitmap for the purpose of its conversion and transformation.

member.name: M:C1.WPF.Bitmap.C1Bitmap.CreatePredefinedPalette(C1.WPF.Bitmap.PaletteType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates one of the pre-defined palettes specified by PaletteType and optionally adds a transparent color.
member.param: The desired pre-defined palette type.
The optional transparent color to add to the palette. If no transparent color is needed, use false. When initializing to a grayscale or black and white palette, set this parameter to false.
member.remarks: For palettes with less than 256 entries, the transparent entry is added to the end of the palette (that is, a 16-color palette becomes a 17-color palette). For palettes with 256 colors, the transparent palette entry will replace the last entry in the pre-defined palette.

member.name: M:C1.WPF.Bitmap.C1Bitmap.CreatePaletteFromBitmap(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a palette using a computed optimized values based on the bitmap.
member.param: The number of colors to initialize the palette with.
A value to indicate whether to add a transparent color.
member.remarks: The resulting palette contains the specified number of colors which best represent the colors present in the bitmap. The algorithm operates on the opaque RGB color value of each pixel in the reference bitmap and hence ignores any alpha values. If a transparent color is required, set the addTransparentColor parameter to true and one fewer optimized color will be computed, reducing the colorCount, and a fully transparent color entry will be added.

member.name: M:C1.WPF.Bitmap.C1Bitmap.GetPalette
member.summary: Retrieves the color table for indexed pixel formats, or null for other formats.

member.name: M:C1.WPF.Bitmap.C1Bitmap.SetPalette(C1.WPF.Bitmap.C1Bitmap.Palette)
member.summary: Sets the new color table for the bitmap.

member.summary: Represents the bitmap palette for indexed pixel formats.

member.summary: Gets the list of palette colors (allows modifications).

member.summary: Determines if the current pixel format can be converted to the destination pixel format.
member.param: The destionation pixel format.

member.name: M:C1.WPF.Bitmap.C1Bitmap.Transform(C1.WPF.Bitmap.BaseTransform[])
member.summary: Creates a new instance of as a copy of the current bitmap passed through the set of transformations.
member.param: The transformation chain, can be empty to just copy the image.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.ContainerFormat.Bmp
member.summary: BMP (Windows Bitmap Format), BMP Specification v5.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.ContainerFormat.Jpeg
member.summary: JPEG (Joint Photographic Experts Group), JFIF Specification 1.02.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.ContainerFormat.JpegXR
member.summary: HD Photo, also known as Windows Media Photo.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.ContainerFormat.Tiff
member.summary: TIFF (Tagged Image File Format), TIFF Specification 6.0.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Bitmap.DitherType
member.summary: Specifies the type of dither algorithm to apply when converting between pixel formats.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.DitherType.None
member.summary: A solid color algorithm without dither.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.DitherType.Solid
member.summary: A solid color algorithm without dither.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Bitmap.InterpolationMode
member.summary: Specifies the sampling or filtering mode to use when scaling an image.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.InterpolationMode.NearestNeighbor
member.summary: A nearest neighbor interpolation algorithm. Also known as nearest pixel or point interpolation.
member.remarks: The output pixel is assigned the value of the pixel that the point falls within. No other pixels are considered.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.InterpolationMode.Linear
member.remarks: The output pixel values are computed as a weighted average of the nearest four pixels in a 2x2 grid.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.InterpolationMode.Cubic
member.remarks: Destination pixel values are computed as a weighted average of the nearest sixteen pixels in a 4x4 grid.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.InterpolationMode.Fant
member.remarks: Destination pixel values are computed as a weighted average of the all the pixels that map to the new pixel.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.InterpolationMode.HighQualityCubic
member.summary: A high quality bicubic interpolation algorithm.
member.remarks: Destination pixel values are computed using a much denser sampling kernel than regular cubic. The kernel is resized in response to the scale factor, making it suitable for downscaling by factors greater than 2. This value is supported beginning with Windows 10.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Bitmap.PaletteType
member.summary: Specifies the type of palette used for indexed pixel formats.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.PaletteType.Custom
member.summary: An arbitrary custom palette provided by caller.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.PaletteType.MedianCut
member.summary: An optimal palette generated using a median-cut algorithm. Derived from the colors in an image.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.PaletteType.FixedHalftone8
member.summary: A palette that has its 8-color on-off primaries and the 16 system colors added. With duplicates removed, 16 colors are available.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.PaletteType.FixedHalftone27
member.summary: A palette that has 3 intensity levels of each primary: 27-color on-off primaries and the 16 system colors added. With duplicates removed, 35 colors are available.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.PaletteType.FixedHalftone64
member.summary: A palette that has 4 intensity levels of each primary: 64-color on-off primaries and the 16 system colors added. With duplicates removed, 72 colors are available.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.PaletteType.FixedHalftone125
member.summary: A palette that has 5 intensity levels of each primary: 125-color on-off primaries and the 16 system colors added. With duplicates removed, 133 colors are available.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.PaletteType.FixedHalftone216
member.summary: A palette that has 6 intensity levels of each primary: 216-color on-off primaries and the 16 system colors added. With duplicates removed, 224 colors are available.
member.remarks: This is the same as FixedHalftoneWeb.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.PaletteType.FixedWebPalette
member.summary: A palette that has 6 intensity levels of each primary: 216-color on-off primaries and the 16 system colors added. With duplicates removed, 224 colors are available.
member.remarks: This is the same as WICBitmapPaletteTypeFixedHalftone216.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.PaletteType.FixedHalftone252
member.summary: A palette that has its 252-color on-off primaries and the 16 system colors added. With duplicates removed, 256 colors are available.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.PaletteType.FixedHalftone256
member.summary: A palette that has its 256-color on-off primaries and the 16 system colors added. With duplicates removed, 256 colors are available.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.PaletteType.FixedGray4
member.summary: A palette that has 4 shades of gray.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.PaletteType.FixedGray16
member.summary: A palette that has 16 shades of gray.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.PaletteType.FixedGray256
member.summary: A palette that has 256 shades of gray.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Bitmap.PixelFormat
member.summary: Describes the memory layout of each pixel in a bitmap.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Bitmap.PngFilter
member.summary: Describes the PNG filters available for compression optimization.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.PngFilter.Unspecified
member.summary: Indicates an unspecified PNG filter. This enables WIC to algorithmically choose the best filtering option for the image.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.PngFilter.Adaptive
member.summary: Indicates a PNG adaptive filter. This enables WIC to choose the best filtering mode on a per-scanline basis.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Bitmap.TiffCompression
member.summary: Specifies the Tagged Image File Format (TIFF) compression options.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.TiffCompression.DontCare
member.summary: Indicates a suitable compression algorithm based on the image and pixel format.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Bitmap.TransformOptions
member.summary: Specifies the flip and rotation transforms.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.TransformOptions.FlipHorizontal
member.summary: A horizontal flip. Pixels are flipped around the vertical y-axis.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.TransformOptions.FlipVertical
member.summary: A vertical flip. Pixels are flipped around the horizontal x-axis.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Bitmap.ImageRect
member.summary: Represents a rectangle for clipping images.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.ImageRect.X
member.summary: The horizontal coordinate of the rectangle.

member.name: F:C1.WPF.Bitmap.ImageRect.Y
member.summary: The vertical coordinate of the rectangle.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Bitmap.ImageRect.Right

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Bitmap.ImageRect.Bottom

member.summary: Determines if the specified point is contained within this rectangle.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Bitmap.BaseOptions
member.summary: Base class for all encoder options.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Bitmap.BaseOptions.SourceRect
member.summary: Specifies the source rectangle for encoding.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Bitmap.BmpOptions
member.summary: Encoder options supported by the native BMP codec.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Bitmap.BmpOptions.EnableV5Header32bppBGRA
member.summary: Specifies whether the BMP should be written using the BITMAPV5HEADER with valid alpha channel content.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Bitmap.GifOptions
member.summary: Encoder options supported by the native GIF codec.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Bitmap.JpegOptions
member.summary: Encoder options supported by the native JPEG codec.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Bitmap.JpegOptions.ImageQuality
member.summary: Specifies the desired image fidelity. 0.0 indicates the lowest possible fidelity and 1.0 specifies the highest fidelity.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Bitmap.JpegOptions.TransformOptions
member.summary: Specifies whether the image is rotated or flipped when decoded.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Bitmap.JpegOptions.SuppressApp0
member.summary: Specifies whether to suppress the write of App0 metadata while encoding the image data.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Bitmap.JpegXROptions
member.summary: Encoder options supported by the native JPEG XR codec.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Bitmap.JpegXROptions.AlphaDataDiscard
member.summary: Sets the amount of alpha frequency data to discard during a compressed domain transcode.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Bitmap.JpegXROptions.AlphaQuality
member.summary: Sets the compression quality for the planar alpha channel image.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Bitmap.JpegXROptions.TransformOptions
member.summary: Specifies whether the image is rotated or flipped when decoded.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Bitmap.JpegXROptions.CompressedDomainTranscode
member.summary: Enables or disables compressed domain transcoding.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Bitmap.JpegXROptions.HorizontalTileSlices
member.summary: Sets the number of horizontal tiles.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Bitmap.JpegXROptions.IgnoreOverlap
member.summary: Specifies how the encoder handles tile boundaries during a compressed domain transcode.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Bitmap.JpegXROptions.ImageDataDiscard
member.summary: Sets the amount of image frequency data to discard during a compressed domain transcode.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Bitmap.JpegXROptions.InterleavedAlpha
member.summary: Specifies whether to encode interleaved alpha or planar alpha.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Bitmap.JpegXROptions.Overlap
member.summary: Sets the level of overlap filtering.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Bitmap.JpegXROptions.Subsampling
member.summary: Sets the chroma subsampling. This property applies only to RGB images.
member.remarks: The default value is 3 if ImageQuality > 0.8; otherwise 1.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Bitmap.JpegXROptions.UseCodecOptions
member.summary: Specifies whether to use the Quality, Overlap, and Subsampling properties instead of the generic ImageQuality property.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Bitmap.JpegXROptions.VerticalTileSlices
member.summary: Sets the number of vertical tiles.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Bitmap.PngOptions
member.summary: Encoder options supported by the native PNG codec.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Bitmap.PngOptions.Interlace
member.summary: Specifies whether to encode the image data as interlaced.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Bitmap.PngOptions.Filter
member.summary: Specifies the filter option to use for image compression.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Bitmap.TiffOptions
member.summary: Encoder options supported by the native TIFF codec.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.Bitmap.TiffOptions.CompressionQuality
member.summary: Specifies the desired compression quality. A value of 1.0 specifies the most efficient compression schema available.

member.name: T:C1.WPF.Bitmap.BaseTransform
member.summary: Base class for all bitmap transformations.

member.summary: Produces a clipped version of the bitmap for a specified rectangular region of interest.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
